intro: Haplophyllum pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf rockfoil, is a small, low-growing perennial plant native to the rocky and arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in spring, adding a delicate touch to its rocky habitat. It is adapted to survive in harsh conditions with minimal water, making it a resilient species in its native environment. Haplophyllum pumilum is often found in crevices and on rock surfaces, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
